span.p: Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Meetings Act, Chapter 231, 1975, be advised that the Rochelle Park Board of Education has changed the time of the Regular Meeting to 6:00 P.M., to be held at Midland School, 300 Rochelle Avenue, Rochelle Park, New Jersey as follows:

Due to the state of emergency declared by the Governments of the State of New Jersey and the United States regarding COVID-19, the TUESDAY, April 28, 2020 Board Meeting is being held via video conference. To view the meeting live, please use the following link:

Members of the public may remotely access and provide written public comments at this Board Meeting through ZOOM, a remote video conferencing system. Specific instructions for accessing the Board Meeting and providing public comments will be posted to the home page and Board of Education’s page of the Board’s website. All public written comments must include the sender’s full name and address and will be read aloud at the Board Meeting.
If you are using a SmartPhone, you can download the Zoom app here:
Public comments will be done through email. Please email questions/comments to BOEquestions@rochellepark.org
Please include in the subject if the questions/comments are for: Questions/Comments on Agenda Items, or General Questions/Comments.
You MUST include your name and address along with your questions/comments.

a.title: Go to comments for April 28, 2020 Board of Education Meeting

strong.span: Please note the following William Street Parking Notifications

div.span: It shall be unlawful for any person to park or leave standing any vehicle on lands of another, whether publicly or privately owned in the Township of Rochelle Park, after notice has been posted as hereinafter provided by the owner, occupant, lessee or licensee prohibiting such parking. Nothing herein contained shall apply to any lands lying within the bounds of any public street or highway. Parking shall be prohibited in the following specific locations as follows:

A. Midland School parking lot. Parking is hereby restricted in the Midland School parking lot to staff members only between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. All vehicles double-parked in said lot during said hours, in addition to the above, shall be considered as illegally parked.

B. William Street parking area. No parking shall be permitted in the area adjacent to the school grounds on William Street between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, when school is in session. During these hours this area shall be for the exclusive use of parents for the purpose of discharging and picking up children. All other vehicles parking in this area during those times shall be considered as illegally parked. In the William Street parking area no person shall park a vehicle whenever snow is falling and the accumulation is such that it covers the parking area. Such parking prohibition shall remain in effect until after the snow fall has ceased and the snow has been cleared from the parking area.

a.title: Go to comments for Parking Notice

p.span: ALL parents should complete a GENESIS PARENT PORTAL form to set-up a parent account. Please complete the form below and submit to the main office to set-up your account.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent Portal

p.span: Strategic technology integration is key to supplementing an authentic, engaging, and relevant learning environment. Midland School has been moving toward that goal over the past few years as we have significantly upgraded our technology infrastructure. We continue moving forward with our 1:1 Chromebook initiative at Midland School. Every 5th, 6th, 7th, and 8th grade student is receiving a Chromebook that will be used to foster creativity, critical thinking, and collaboration. Students are provided daily access to valuable applications and resources to strengthen student achievement across the curriculum and foster the development of 21st century skills.

Attached please find our updated Chromebook Handbook, which includes important guidelines, procedures and information regarding our 1:1 program. Additionally, attached is our latest Chromebook agreement that must be reviewed and signed by parents/guardians so that your student can receive their device.

span.strong: Please take the time to do the following in order to

p.span: (1) Read and review all the information carefully
(3) Return the signed agreement to your homeroom teacher (Grade 5) or main office (Grades 6-8)
(4) Process payment on the district’s RevTrack system at https://rochellepark.revtrak.net/chromebooks/#/list
Once the agreement is returned and payment has been confirmed, your child's Chromebook will be issued.

Students who qualify for the free/reduced lunch program may be eligible for a waiver of the $35 fee. Contact Cheryl Jiosi our Business Administrator for validation of your waiver status at cjiosi@rochellepark.org or at 201-843-3120 ext. 516. If you have any questions/concerns, please feel free to contact me directly at malberta@rochellepark.org.
We look forward to another successful year as we continue to move forward with our technology.

a.title: Go to comments for Chromebook Information
